description: A special rice cake (mochimaki) containing a valuable diamond worth 10,000,000 rio berry. This prized mochimaki is the centerpiece of the Great Mochimaki Festival in Grand Jipangu.
significance: The diamond mochimaki serves as the MacGuffin driving the plot of Episode 292. Buggy's schemes revolve around stealing it, while its ultimate fate (being caught and then discarded by Zoro) reinforces character themes about the value of honor over material wealth.
culturalContext: Mochimaki is a real Japanese tradition where rice cakes are thrown during celebrations, particularly New Year's festivities. The addition of a valuable prize inside one of the mochi represents good fortune for the new year.
